issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

found against 1.4.1 f88b9e

1.use the script below and run the content

results: only one object shows, there should be 4 (one on each side) as on iPhone.

var win = Titanium.UI.currentWindow;

var view = Titanium.UI.createView({
borderRadius:10, backgroundColor:'red', width:50, height:50, top:5 });

var view1 = Titanium.UI.createView({
borderRadius:10, backgroundColor:'red', width:50, height:50, bottom:5 });

var view2 = Titanium.UI.createView({
borderRadius:10, backgroundColor:'red', width:50, height:50, right:5 });

var view3 = Titanium.UI.createView({
borderRadius:10, backgroundColor:'red', width:50, height:50, left:5 }); win.add(view,view1,view2,view3);

{html}
fields.summary: Android: Only one object appears when multiple views should be  drawn.

comments.body:
{html}

Documentation for add is clearly in the "singular", so probably that should be updated too.

{html}
